result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert L Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 3 day(s) RCJ for contempt for failure to pay.  $200 DNA surcharge assessed.
***Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law prior being released from jail.***

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Notice of Intent     Return to sender - Not deliverable as addressed; Unable to forward
Per RASO - mandatory jail time has been served

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: ***10-21-15 $1000 CASH BOND AMENDED TO $500 CASH***  No contact with the victim, FAS (person, property, residence or family).   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Robert L Johnson in court with attorney Gretchen G. Rosenke.  Defendant Robert L Johnson in custody.  Matthew J. Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Matter is scheduled on Def's Motion to modify bond.
Def is requesting that bond be modified to a signature bond.
State objects to any bond modification.
BTC: Modify bond to a $500 cash, all other conditions remain.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Pre-trial conference at 10-29-2015 03:15 pm.
Status conference at 12-07-2015 08:30 am.
